alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 12:41PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Butler County through 115 PM CDT... At 1241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Towanda, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Towanda and Potwin. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 66 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
